channel.title: Epiphany
channel.description:
So I like just had an epiphany.
We always talk about how RuneScape is so horrible now, and it was so fun back in 2004-2007. I agree, some things could've been done better, and some updates shouldn't be added, but I think the main reason we miss the old game is because that was when we enjoyed playing it. What I mean by that is, [b]WE ALL GREW UP.[/b] We outgrew RuneScape, and we say that we miss the 2004-2007 era because that's when we enjoyed the game. Maybe that's just my opinion, what do you guys think?

item.title: Epiphany
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

That’s odd, I’m only 04 and I thought fist of guthix was the least fun and least creative.

Read full topic

item.title: Epiphany
item.dc:creator: @Eddie_Crosswall Eddie Crosswall
item.description:
@Eddie_Crosswall wrote:

Didn’t you get the memo it’s botscape now.

On topic: I somewhat agree with you. As a player from 2005 I thought clan wars was awesome. Then fist of guthix arrived I fell in love with that. My account got hacked for a short period of time. I got it back and found nothing on it(of course…) I came back a while later I just saw that RuneScape over time evolved again. I dont think it is as much as we outgrew it, but we just didn’t evolve with the times.

Read full topic

item.title: Epiphany
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

I enjoy the game now, I would play, but I don’t I can’t do anything without being asked something, trolled, followed, begged for money, can’t skill, there’s too many bots.

Read full topic

item.title: Epiphany
item.dc:creator: @judostar1 judostar1
item.description:
@judostar1 wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:16, topic:416821”]I’m going to agree. The game and myself started to grow apart. More games came into advancement, and at the time Runescape was a breed of its own.

I’ve grown up, so has runescape.[/quote]

this ^^^, and tbh people that are making remakes it’s mainly for their own satisfaction of remembering their childhood I guess. We only really think it was the good years because those were the years when we joined and had fun, when we were little.

As you’ve said, we’ve grown up and so has runescape.

Read full topic

I’m going to agree. The game and myself started to grow apart. More games came into advancement, and at the time Runescape was a breed of its own.

I’ve grown up, so has runescape.

item.title: Epiphany
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

reyx7:

But we still can all agree this game had gotten out of control? Bots easy enough for anyone with Google to get, loyalty points and buying back banned accounts?

yeah, it has.

vManlyMan:

The point I was trying to make is that people who played in 2001-2003, probably said in 2004-2007 that the game was shit as well.

exactly

Read full topic

item.title: Epiphany
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:13, topic:416821”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=518762.msg3770145#msg3770145 date=1317595240]
But we still can all agree this game had gotten out of control? Bots easy enough for anyone with Google to get, loyalty points and buying back banned accounts?
[/quote]
I never found out how to actually buy back a banned account, I think that was just a rummor. I have quite a few banned accounts and I never got any offers. :([/quote]
Just put membership on it, it’ll have between -30 and -180 days. Just purchase that much.

Read full topic

item.title: Epiphany
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

I imagine that the people who were our age, assuming that ‘we’ are 15-20 year olds, back in 2004-2007 wanted “The good ol’ days” back. Just for them the days were 2001-2003. They were most likely whining about updates, and getting mad at how bad scamming was becoming. It’s probably just a phase that people go through at ‘our’ age.

Read full topic

item.title: Epiphany
item.dc:creator: @judostar1 judostar1
item.description:
@judostar1 wrote:

[quote=“Xx Weed Xx, post:6, topic:416821”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=518762.msg3770055#msg3770055 date=1317591225]

but were we really that much better? what about the people who were our age in 2004? or older?

I don’t remember as many snobby arrogant assholes. Begging and scammed still existed (100k vs 1004 gp), but there wasn’t as many rude people. Botting was less common as well.
[/quote]

I remember working my ass off to get a rune plate, bought it then some guy offered me 120k for it. I was spam clicking accept and he kept putting items up then taking them away and I was like WTF hurry up spamming clicking on the accept button and without realizing, he changed 120k to 12k I didn’t notice I’d been scammed till I accepted the trade. I was so mad lulz.[/quote]

samething happened to me, except i wanted to buy a black sword and this guy took all my gold withot giving me my sword. :L

Read full topic

item.title: Epiphany
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

I agree, I use to play for fun, now I play to relax after work.

Read full topic

item.title: Epiphany
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Remember how similar noted rune and iron looked? And all the people selling charcoal and spinach rolls? You never see that anymore. Evil chickens, water trolls, rock golems… so much is gone.

Read full topic

item.title: Epiphany
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

It isn’t just that we grew up, it’s that the younger generation took over and they have no respect for anyone anymore. It makes me wonder how these kids actually get to play online or what their parents are doing.

Read full topic

item.title: Epiphany
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

People were less of dicks then. I feel like I can barely talk to anyone without them asking to see my “cash stack” or what my stats are. The game is to easy interface nowadays and to easy to join. Leveling up is significantly faster, and the economy is driving itself into the ground from bots.

It’s all snot nosed arrogant kids nowadays who spend to much time either playing or botting just to brag. What people don’t realize is that it’s just a game and that by botting you’re not actually doing what the game was made for, which is to kill time and have fun.

Read full topic
